Question: While on a tour of the White Mountains, this person died in his sleep on May 19, 1864, in Plymouth, New Hampshire.
Hints: This person wrote in the comparative obscurity of what he called his "owl's nest" in the family home.
This person and his family moved to a small red farmhouse near Lenox, Massachusetts at the end of March 1850.
This person was predominantly a short story writer in his early career.
